idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3500

descript.abstract: United States Five-Digit ZIP Code Areas is a polygon theme representing five-digit ZIP Code areas used by the U.S. Postal Service to deliver mail more effectively. The first digit of a five-digit ZIP Code divides the United States into 10 large groups of states numbered from 0 in the Northeast to 9 in the far West. Within these areas, each state is divided into an average of 10 smaller geographical areas, identified by the second and third digits. These digits, in conjunction with the first digit, represent a sectional center facility or a mail processing facility area. The fourth and fifth digits identify a post office, station, branch or local delivery area. This dataset is a part of the 2010 ESRI Data & Maps collection.
descript.purpose: United States Five-Digit ZIP Code Areas provides area, post office name, and population for each ZIP Code area in the United States.
descript.supplinf:
Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:50,000.
This dataset comes with three ESRI layer files symbolizing the features.

citeinfo.title: United States Five-Digit ZIP Code Areas, 2010

Outside the United States– Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local ESRI Office. This information can be found at http://www.esri.com/company/locations.html.
For other questions or comments, you may contact ESRI headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

enttyp.enttypd: The polygons identify areas where mail is delivered (from a city block or two to a whole rural town) within the United States.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The five-digit number used by the postal service to identify an area where mail is delivered.

codesetd.codesetn: USPS National 5-Digit ZIP Code® and Post Office Directory
USPS National 5-Digit ZIP Code and Post Office Directory

attr.attrdef: The two-letter abbreviation for the state in which the ZIP Code area is located.
The sum of the 2000 population for the Census Bureau Block polygon centroids which fall within the Zip Code area.
attr.attrdefs: ESRI; Department of Commerce, Census Bureau

attr.attrdef: The 2010 estimated population of the ZIP Code area.
The 2010 estimated population of the ZIP Code area per square mile.

attrdomv.udom: Calculated populations per square mile for the features.

attr.attrdef: The area of the ZIP Code polygon in square miles using Albers Equal Area Projection.

digtinfo.formspec: The SDC file contains the geospatial and attribute data. The SDI file contains the spatial index. The PRJ file contains the coordinate system information (optional). The XML file (*.sdc.xml) contains the metadata describing the data set (optional).

stdorder.ordering: ESRI Data & Maps is available only as part of ESRI® software.

distinfo.techpreq: To use this data requires software that supports SDC files.

citeinfo.title: ESRI Business Analyst Desktop 9.3.1 - U.S. ZIP Code Areas, 2010

srcinfo.srccitea: ESRI Business Analyst Desktop 9.3.1 - U.S. ZIP Code Areas

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by ESRI: Extracted the data set from Tele Atlas MultiNet Post 2010.03. Attached and formatted the STATE field from 2009 Data Update U.S. ZIP Code Areas (Five-Digit). Added the SQMI field and calculated its values. Added the POP2010 field from ESRI Data. Added the POP10_SQMI field and calculated its values. Added and calculated the SUMBLKPOP field by overlaying U.S. Census Block Centroid Populations and then summing the Census Block centroids that fall within each ZIP Code area. Converted the data set to SDC. Created ArcGIS® layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.

horizpa.horizpar: Horizontal positional accuracy is dependent on geographic area. In most areas, accuracy is between 5 and 25 meters (16 and 82 feet). In some areas, accuracy is off by up to several tens of meters (100 feet or more). In the poorest areas, accuracy is off by up to 100 meters (328 feet).

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using either tools in ArcGIS or ESRI SDC Data Development Kit Professional 2 (DDKP2). The SDC data set is then imported into a file geodatabase to verify and validate the geometry.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.
